com.vmware.vstats

Interface Counters

  • All Superinterfaces:
    com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService, CountersTypes, Service
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    CountersStub

    public interface Counters
extends Service, CountersTypes, com.vmware.vapi.internal.bindings.CompletionStageService
    The Counters interface provides methods to perform various Counter related operations. Counter is derived from metric. It applies the metric to a particular class of a resource. Warning: This interface is available as Technology Preview. These are early access APIs provided to test, automate and provide feedback on the feature. Since this can change based on feedback, VMware does not guarantee backwards compatibility and recommends against using them in production environments. Some Technology Preview APIs might only be applicable to specific environments.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static interface  Counters.GetInvocation
      Invocable that represents the Counters#get vAPI operation.
      static interface  Counters.ListInvocation
      Invocable that represents the Counters#list vAPI operation.

      • Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface com.vmware.vstats.CountersTypes

        CountersTypes.FilterSpec, CountersTypes.Info

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface com.vmware.vstats.CountersTypes

        _VAPI_SERVICE_ID, RESOURCE_TYPE

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Counters.GetInvocation get(java.lang.String cid)
      Returns information about a specific Counter.
      Counters.ListInvocation list()
      Returns information about all counters matching the filter parameters.

    • Method Detail

      • list

        Counters.ListInvocation list()
        Returns information about all counters matching the filter parameters. Warning: This method is available as Technology Preview. These are early access APIs provided to test, automate and provide feedback on the feature. Since this can change based on feedback, VMware does not guarantee backwards compatibility and recommends against using them in production environments. Some Technology Preview APIs might only be applicable to specific environments.

        Invocation Result:
        List of Counters.

        Returns:
        instance of Counters.ListInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described list operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        Error - if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
        InvalidArgument - if any of the specified parameters are invalid.
        Unauthenticated - if the user can not be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user does not have sufficient privileges.

      • get

        Counters.GetInvocation get(java.lang.String cid)
        Returns information about a specific Counter. Warning: This method is available as Technology Preview. These are early access APIs provided to test, automate and provide feedback on the feature. Since this can change based on feedback, VMware does not guarantee backwards compatibility and recommends against using them in production environments. Some Technology Preview APIs might only be applicable to specific environments.

        Invocation Result:
        Information about the requested counter.

        Parameters:
        cid - Counter ID. The parameter must be an identifier for the resource type: com.vmware.vstats.model.Counter.
        Returns:
        instance of Counters.GetInvocation which upon invoke executes the above described get operation. The operation result or the operation error will be stored in the CompletionStageFuture that invoke returns.
        Throws:
        Error - if the system reports an error while responding to the request.
        InvalidArgument - if cid is invalid.
        NotFound - if Counter could not be located.
        Unauthenticated - if the user can not be authenticated.
        Unauthorized - if the user does not have sufficient privileges.
